info.title: TRISA Envoy API
info.description: The TRISA Envoy API allows users to interact with their TRISA open source Envoy node in a programmatic fashion. The API allows users to manage server objects such as accounts and counterparties and to send and manage Travel Rule transactions without having to know the details of the TRISA or TRP protocols.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: API authentication is handled using JWT access and refresh tokens that can be obtained with an API key composed of a client ID and secret.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: Accounts store information about your users and their crypto wallets for compliance purposes.

tags.name: Crypto Addresses
tags.description: A resource nested under accounts for tracking which wallet addresses for which blockchain networks belong to which accounts.

tags.name: Counterparties
tags.description: Counterparties define remote VASP peers with whom you can exchange Travel Rule information for compliance purposes.

tags.name: Transactions
tags.description: Transactions refer to an instance of a travel rule information exchange related to a specific on-chain virtual asset transfer.

tags.name: Preparing Transactions
tags.description: The prepared transactions workflow allows you to easily create IVMS101 with a simplified form and create a transaction and send it in fewer steps than it would be to manually create a transaction and send a secure envelope to the counterparty.

tags.name: Transaction Actions
tags.description: These actions allow you to move a transaction through the travel rule compliance resolution workflow.

tags.name: Secure Envelopes
tags.description: Secure envelopes store PII data in an encrypted fashion and record an audit log of information exchanges with a counterparty about a specific transaction.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: Envoy user access management and identity control for compliance auditing purposes.

tags.name: API  Keys
tags.description: Envoy API client access management and identity control for compliance auditing purposes.

tags.name: Utilities
tags.description: Other useful API methods and helper functionality not associated with a REST resource.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Webhooks for making callbacks to an API client system.

Reply.title: Reply
Reply.description: A standard reply object that is used to indicate success with a JSON body if required.

success.description: Set to true if the request was successful, false if there was an error.

ErrorReply.title: ErrorReply
ErrorReply.description: A general error reply that includes the details of why the request was bad.

success.description: Set to true if the request was successful, false if there was an error (see reply).

error.description: A short description of the error intended to help the user fix the request and retry.

FieldErrors.title: FieldErrors
FieldErrors.description: A set of errors used to indicate problems with specific fields in the request body.

success.description: Set to true if the request was successful, false if there was an error (see error reply).

error.description: A quick description of how many errors occurred.

errors.description: A list of the fields and their associated errors.

items.description: An individual field error that specifies the name of the field and the validation error.

field.description: The name of the field in the request body (may be "." delimited to indicate nested fields).

error.description: A brief description of the validation error that occurred.
error.example: not a valid ISO-3166-1 Alpha 2 country code

example.error: not a valid ISO-3166-1 Alpha 2 country code
common name must be a valid domain name with a correct tld
not a valid ISO-3166-1 Alpha 2 country code

errors.error: common name must be a valid domain name with a correct tld
not a valid ISO-3166-1 Alpha 2 country code

PageInfo.title: PageInfo
PageInfo.description: The page info for the current page of a paginated list resource.

page_size.description: The number of items on the current page, defaults to the page size requested in the page query.

next_page_token.description: An encrypted handle that can be used in a page query to return the next page of results after this current page.

prev_page_token.description: An encrypted handle that can be used in a page query to return the previous page of results after this current page.

APIAuthentication.title: APIAuthentication
APIAuthentication.description: Authenticate an API Key using its client ID and secret to receive a JWT bearer token.

client_id.description: The client ID of the API Key for authentication.

client_secret.description: The client secret of the API Key for authentication.

LoginReply.title: LoginReply
LoginReply.description: Returns two JWT tokens. The access token should be used as a Bearer token in the Authorization header. The refresh token can be used to obtain a new access token when it expires to reauthenticate without having to post the client ID and secret again.

access_token.description: The access token with API key claims that should be used as the Bearer token in the Authorization header.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token can be used to re-authenticate an expired access token, so long as the refresh token is still valid.

ReauthenticateRequest.title: ReauthenticateRequest
ReauthenticateRequest.description: Reauthenticate an expired `access_token` to receive a new access token without having to authenticate with your API key credentials.

refresh_token.description: The JWT refresh token for re-authentication

Account.title: Account
Account.description: An account of a customer whose identity information is required for compliance. Accounts are also associated with crypto wallet addresses.

id.description: The unique identifier of the account on your Envoy node.

customer_id.description: An internal customer ID associated with the account that links it to your customer management system.

first_name.description: The first or "secondary" name of the customer account.

last_name.description: The last or "primary" name of the customer account, often a family name. This name is used to sort accounts.

ivms101.description: The base64 encoded representation of a JSON or protocol buffer IVMS101 record for the natural person on the account.

travel_address.description: The customer account travel address that allows counterparties to send this account travel rule inquiries.

crypto_addresses.description: A list of crypto addresses associated with the account.

created.description: The date and time when the account record was created.

modified.description: The date and time when the account record was last modified.

AccountForm.title: AccountForm
AccountForm.description: The editable fields in a customer account object.

customer_id.description: The internal customer ID can be changed at any time, thought it is not recommended.

first_name.description: The first or "secondary" name of the customer account can be modified.

last_name.description: The last or "primary" name of the customer account, often a family name, can be modified.

ivms101.description: The base64 encoded representation of a JSON or protocol buffer IVMS101 record for the natural person on the account can be modified but must be parseable.

AccountSummary.title: AccountSummary
AccountSummary.description: A summary of customer account details that is used in account lists to minimize data transfer.

id.description: The unique identifier of the account on your Envoy node - used to construct the detail URL.

customer_id.description: An internal customer ID associated with the account to reference in your customer management system.

first_name.description: The first or "secondary" name of the natural person associated with the customer account.

last_name.description: The last or "primary" name of the natural person assoociated customer account. This name is used to sort accounts.

travel_address.description: A travel address that the customer can send to request payment using virtual assets.

created.description: The date and time when the account record was created in the database.

modified.description: The date and time when the account record was last modified in the database.

AccountList.title: AccountList
AccountList.description: A list of Account objects, returned in a paginated fashion.

CryptoAddress.title: CryptoAddress
CryptoAddress.description: A record of a crypto wallet address and the blockchain network that wallet belongs to.

id.description: The unique identifier of the crypto address on your Envoy node.

crypto_address.description: The crypto or wallet address for the blockchain network.

network.description: The network the crypto wallet address belongs to in SLIP-0044 three-character encoding.

asset_type.description: If the network supports multiple asset types, the description of the asset type managed by the wallet.

tag.description: The memo or destination tag associated with the crypto wallet address if required by the network.

travel_address.description: The wallet specific travel address that allows counterparties to send travel rule inquiries associated with the wallet.

created.description: The date and time when the crypto address record was created.

modified.description: The date and time when the crypto address record was last modified.

CryptoAddressList.title: CryptoAddressList
CryptoAddressList.description: A list of CryptoAddress objects, returned in a paginated fashion.

CryptoAddressForm.title: CryptoAddressForm
CryptoAddressForm.description: The editable fields of a crypto wallet address for create and update.

crypto_address.description: The crypto or wallet address for the blockchain network (required).

network.description: The network the crypto wallet address belongs to in SLIP-0044 three-character encoding (required).

asset_type.description: If the network supports multiple asset types, the description of the asset type managed by the wallet. This field is not validated.

tag.description: The memo or destination tag associated with the crypto wallet address if required by the network. This field is not validated.

Counterparty.title: Counterparty
Counterparty.description: Defines remote VASPs with whom you can exchange Travel Rule information and how to connect to them using a peer-to-peer network.

id.description: The unique identifier of the counterparty on your Envoy node.

source.description: the source of the counterparty, e.g. gds means the record was created from the TRISA global directory service.

directory_id.description: the unique identifier of the counterparty on the registered directory service.

registered_directory.description: the name of the directory service the counterparty is registered with if the source is gds.

protocol.description: the travel rule protocol used to connect to the counterparty with.

common_name.description: the common name of the travel rule domain of the counterparty; used for uniquely identifying the counterparty.

endpoint.description: the URL endpoint to connect to using the travel rule protocol. For TRISA this will be host:port and for TRP will be a URL.

travel_address.description: The counterparty travel address that allows the user to identify which counterparty to use in a transfer.

name.description: The name of the counterparty, usually the counterparty's legal or trading name.

website.description: The website of the counterparty, used to lookup the counterparty's online information.

country.description: The 2 character country code of the country that the counterparty is registered in or primarily operates in.

business_category.description: The business category defined by the VASP in their TRIXO form for TRISA registration.

items.description: Self reported virtual asset services provided by the counterparty.

verified_on.description: The date and time when the counterparty record was verified as being a TRISA member on the network your node is connected to.

ivms101.description: The base64 encoded representation of a JSON or protocol buffer IVMS101 record for the legal person of the counterparty.

created.description: The date and time when the counterparty record was created.

modified.description: The date and time when the counterparty record was last modified.

CounterpartyForm.title: CounterpartyForm
CounterpartyForm.description: Defines the editable fields to create or update counterparty record. Note that only counterparties created with the user or peer source may be edited.

protocol.description: Specify the travel rule protocol used to connect to the counterparty with; this will likely be TRP or email since TRISA counterparties are fetched from the GDS.

common_name.description: Specify the common name of the travel rule domain of the counterparty; used for uniquely identifying the counterparty.

endpoint.description: Specify the URL endpoint to connect to using the travel rule protocol.

name.description: The name of the counterparty, usually the counterparty's legal or trading name -- for identying counterparty VASPs with search.

website.description: The website of the counterparty, used to lookup the counterparty's online information or reference their online presence.

country.description: Specify the 2 character country code of the country that the counterparty is registered in or primarily operates in.

business_category.description: Specify a business category for the VASP for local compliance reference.

items.description: Specify the known virtual asset services provided by the counterparty for compliance purposes.

ivms101.description: The base64 encoded representation of a JSON or protocol buffer IVMS101 record for the legal person of the counterparty can be modified but must be parseable.

CounterpartySummary.title: CounterpartySummary
CounterpartySummary.description: A summary of counterparty fields to return in counterparty lists to conserve memory.

id.description: The unique identifier of the counterparty on your Envoy node - used to construct the detail url.

source.description: The source of the counterparty, used to filter the returned list.

protocol.description: the travel rule protocol used to connect to the counterparty with, used to filter the returned list.

endpoint.description: the URL endpoint to connect to using the travel rule protocol.

name.description: The name of the counterparty, usually the counterparty's legal or trading name, for quick identification of a counterparty.

website.description: The website of the counterparty, used to identify the counterparty based on domain records.

country.description: The 2 character country code of the country that the counterparty is registered in or primarily operates in to assist in counterparty identification.

created.description: The date and time when the counterparty record was created for ordering purposes.

CounterpartyList.title: CounterpartyList
CounterpartyList.description: A list of Counterparty objects, returned in a paginated fashion.

Transaction.title: Transaction
Transaction.description: A transaction is a travel rule information exchange related to an on-chain transfer of virtual assets for compliance purposes. The Envoy node stores the transaction information in a decrypted form for indexing and search, but the PII of a transaction is stored in secure envelopes, which are encrypted and exchanged with the counterparty.

id.description: The transaction ID, also the TRISA envelope ID (must be a UUID).

source.description: The originating source of the transaction; "local" if this was an outgoing transaction from this Envoy node, "remote" if this is an incoming transaction from a counterparty.

status.description: The current status of the travel rule transaction, which defines the actions the compliance officer should take.

counterparty.description: The name or common name of the counterparty as determined by the Envoy node.

counterparty_id.description: The ID of the counterparty in the counterparties table of the Envoy node.

originator.description: The name of the originator as determined by the Envoy node.

originator_address.description: The crypto wallet address of the originator as determined by the Envoy node.

beneficiary.description: The name of the beneficiary as determined by the Envoy node.

beneficiary_address.description: The crypto wallet address of the beneficiary as determined by the Envoy node.

virtual_asset.description: A representation of the network and virtual asset that defines the on-chain transaction.

amount.description: The amount of the on-chain transaction as defined by the smallest unit of that virtual asset.

last_update.description: The timestamp of the last activity on the transaction; usually a secure envelope sent or received.

envelope_count.description: The number of envelopes sent back and forth between your node and the counterparty.

created.description: The timestamp that the transaction record was created.

modified.description: The timestamp that the transaction record was last modified.

TransactionForm.title: TransactionForm
TransactionForm.description: The editable fields that can be used to create or modify a transaction record.

source.description: The originating source of the transaction; generally if using the create method, you should specify "local".

status.description: The current status of the travel rule transaction, which should be set based on actions taken by compliance officers or the remote counterparty.

counterparty.description: The name or common name of the counterparty for filtering and searching.

counterparty_id.description: The ID of the counterparty for better counterparty lookup.

originator.description: The name of the originator of the transaction.

originator_address.description: The crypto wallet address of the originator of the transaction.

beneficiary.description: The name of the beneficiary the transfer is going to.

beneficiary_address.description: The crypto wallet address of the beneficiary the transfer is going to.

virtual_asset.description: The network and virtual asset of the on-chain transaction.

amount.description: The amount of the the smallest unit of the virtual asset for the blockchain.

TransactionList.title: TransactionList
TransactionList.description: A list of transaction objects, returned in a paginated fashion.

SecureEnvelope.title: SecureEnvelope
SecureEnvelope.description: A secure envelope holds an encrypted payload that contains the PII compliance information related to a transaction. The goal of a TRISA transaction is for both counterparties to have identical secure envelope payloads, encrypted so that only each counterparty may view the payload. TRP messages are also stored in secure envelopes, though there is no guarantee of how the data is being stored on the counterparty.

SecureEnvelopeSummary.title: SecureEnvelopeSummary
SecureEnvelopeSummary.description: The subset of secure envelope fields that are returned as a summary for lists of secure envelopes to minimize data transfer.

Envelope.title: Envelope
Envelope.description: An envelope is a decrypted version of a secure envelope and is used either to allow the Envoy node to perform decryption on behalf of the API client or for the API client to send data to the Envoy node for conversion into a secure envelope.

EnvelopeSummary.title: EnvelopeSummary
EnvelopeSummary.description: The subset of envelope fields that provide a summary for envelope list requests to minimize data transfer.

EnvelopeList.title: EnvelopeList
EnvelopeList.description: A list of either secure envelopes or [decrypted] envelopes, returned in a paginated fashion.

Rejection.title: Rejection
Rejection.description: A rejection is used to send a TRISA error back to the counterparty. There are two types of errors. A "Rejection" (reply=false) informs the counterparty that the on-chain transaction should not proceed because compliance requirements could not be met. A "Repair" (reply=true) informs the counterparty that there is some issue with the compliance information that needs to be fixed before the on-chain transaction can proceed.

Repair.title: Repair
Repair.description: A repair object sends the transaction data along with the repair message from the counterparty so that the API client can make fixes to appropriately conclude the travel rule transaction.

Prepare.title: Prepare
Prepare.description: The prepare object is a simplified representation of an IVMS101 identity and transaction payload that is packaged in a secure envelope and sent to the counterparty. This object is used to more easily create a travel rule transaction using the prepare endpoint.

travel_address.description: The travel address of the receipient or counterparty VASP -- used to identify the counterparty to add their IVMS101 legal person information.

originator.description: The personal identity information of the originator account holder of the virtual asset transaction.

first_name.description: The first (or secondary) legal name of the originator person.

last_name.description: The last (or primary/family) legal name of the originator person.

customer_id.description: An internal customer id that identifies the originator person in your system.

identification.description: The state issued identification details of the originator person.

type_code.description: The type of identification issued to the originator person.

number.description: The identification number of the state issued ID assigned to the originator person.

country.description: The country that issued the originator person's identification.

dob.description: The date of birth of the originator person.

birth_place.description: The city, state or province, and country where the originator person was born.

addr_line_1.description: The first line of a geographic address (e.g. home address) of the originator person.

addr_line_2.description: The second line of a geographic address (e.g. home address) of the originator person.

city.description: The city of the geographic address (e.g. home address) of the originator person.

state.description: The state or province of the geographic address (e.g. home address) of the originator person.

post_code.description: The postal code of the geographic address (e.g. home address) of the originator person.

country.description: The country of the geographic address (e.g. home address) of the originator person.

crypto_address.description: The crypto wallet address of the originator person where the virtual assets will be transfered from.

beneficiary.description: The personal identity information of the beneficiary account holder of the virtual asset transaction.

first_name.description: The first (or secondary) legal name of the beneficiary person.

last_name.description: The last (or primary/family) legal name of the beneficiary person.

customer_id.description: An internal customer id that identifies the beneficiary person in your system.

identification.description: The state issued identification details of the beneficiary person.

type_code.description: The type of identification issued to the beneficiary person.

number.description: The identification number of the state issued ID assigned to the beneficiary person.

country.description: The country that issued the beneficiary person's identification.

dob.description: The date of birth of the beneficiary person.

birth_place.description: The city, state or province, and country where the beneficiary person was born.

addr_line_1.description: The first line of a geographic address (e.g. home address) of the beneficiary person.

addr_line_2.description: The second line of a geographic address (e.g. home address) of the beneficiary person.

city.description: The city of the geographic address (e.g. home address) of the beneficiary person.

state.description: The state or province of the geographic address (e.g. home address) of the beneficiary person.

post_code.description: The postal code of the geographic address (e.g. home address) of the beneficiary person.

country.description: The country of the geographic address (e.g. home address) of the beneficiary person.

crypto_address.description: The crypto wallet address of the beneficiary person where the virtual assets will be transfered from.

transfer.description: The details of the virtual asset transfer related to the travel rule compliance exchange.

amount.description: The amount of the smallest denomination of the virtual asset that is being transfered from the originator to the beneficiary.

network.description: The three character network code describing the chain the virtual asset belongs to.

asset_type.description: If the network hosts multiple asset types, the identifier of the asset type being transferred.

transaction_id.description: If the transaction has already been completed on the chain, the transaction ID or hash that identifies the block.

tag.description: the memo or destination tag related to the beneficiary wallet for transfer purposes.

Prepared.title: Prepared
Prepared.description: The prepared object is the data representation that you need to start a new travel rule transaction. It can be created using a Prepare, and then this payload can be sent to the send-prepared endpoint to initiate a travel rule transfer by creating a transaction and sending a secure envelope with the payload to the counterparty.

travel_address.description: The travel address of the receipient or counterparty VASP -- used to identify the counterparty and route the travel rule transfer/inquiry.

localNameIdentifiers.legalPersonName: 日本仮想通貨取引所株式会社

IdentityPayload.title: IdentityPayload
IdentityPayload.description: The identity payload implements the IVMS101 spec for inter-VASP messaging of travel rule compliance information. For TRP compatibility purposes, this object uses camelCase JSON fields instead of the snake_case fields that the rest of the API uses. Note that the identity payload is stored as protocol buffers in the Envoy database for compatibility with TRISA transfers. Be aware also that the identity payload is extremely verbose and is intended for use across national boundaries and languages. For more information on the spec and validating the spec, please go to intervasp.org.

localNameIdentifiers.legalPersonName: 日本仮想通貨取引所株式会社

Originator.title: Originator
Originator.description: Originator describes the account holder who allows the virtual asset transfer from that account, or, where there is no account, the natural or legal person that places the order with the originating VASP to perform the virtual asset transfer.

originatorPersons.description: The natural or legal person(s) that describe the Originator.

accountNumber.description: The identifier of an account (a crypto wallet address) for each originator person in the same sequential order.

items.description: Identifier of an account that is used to process the transaction (usually a crypto wallet address).

Beneficiary.title: Beneficiary
Beneficiary.description: Beneficiary describes the natural or legal person arrangement who is identified by the originator as the receiver of the requested virtual asset transfer.

beneficiaryPersons.description: The natural or legal person(s) that describe the Beneficiary.

accountNumber.description: The identifier of an account (a crypto wallet address) for each beneficiary person in the same sequential order.

items.description: Identifier of an account that is used to process the incoming transaction (usually a crypto wallet address).

OriginatingVASP.title: OriginatingVASP
OriginatingVASP.description: The OriginatingVASP describes the VASP that initiates the virtual asset transfer, and transfers the virtual asset upon receiving the request for a virtual asset on behalf of the originator.

BeneficiaryVASP.title: BeneficiaryVASP
BeneficiaryVASP.description: The BeneficiaryVASP describes the VASP which receives the transfer of a virtual asset from the originating VASP directly or through an intermediary VASP and makes the funds available to the beneficiary.

localNameIdentifiers.legalPersonName: 日本仮想通貨取引所株式会社

TransferPath.title: TransferPath
TransferPath.description: The transfer path refers to the intermediary VASP(s) participating in a serial chain that receive(s) and retransmit(s) a virtual asset transfer on behalf of the originating VASP and the beneficiary VASP, or another intermediary VASP, together with their corresponding sequence number.

IntermediaryVASP.title: IntermediaryVASP
IntermediaryVASP.description: The VASP in a serial chain that receives and retransmits a VA transfer on behalf of the originating VASP and the beneficiary VASP, or another intermediary VASP.

sequence.description: the sequence in a serial chain at which the corresponding intermediary VASP participates in the transfer.

PayloadMetadata.title: PayloadMetadata
PayloadMetadata.description: Data describing the contents of the identity payload.

transliterationMethod.description: The method used to map from a national system of writing to Latin script.

items.description: Identifies the national script from which transliteration to Latin script is applied.

Person.title: Person
Person.description: A Person is either a Natural Person (a uniquely distinguishable individual) or a Legal Person (any other entity besides a natural person that can establish a permenant customer relationship with an affected entity or otherwise own property).

addressLines: Abu Dhabi Emirate, Al Dhafrah Region

LegalPerson.title: LegalPerson
LegalPerson.description: An entity other than a natural person that can establish a permenant customer releationship with an affected entityh or otherwise own property. This can include companies, bodies corporate, foundations, anstalt, partnerships, or associations and other relevantly similar entities.

geographicAddress.description: The address of the legal person.

addressLines: Abu Dhabi Emirate, Al Dhafrah Region

customerNumber.description: The unique identification number applied by the VASP to the customer.

countryOfRegistration.description: The country in which the legal person is registered.

addressLines: Abu Dhabi Emirate, Al Dhafrah Region

LegalPersonName.title: LegalPersonName
LegalPersonName.description: The name of the legal person; at least one occurence of the legal person name identifier type must have the value LEGL specified.

nameIdentifier.description: The name and type of name by which the legal person is known.

localNameIdentifier.description: The name and type of name by which the legal person is known using local characters.

phoneticNameIdentifier.description: An alternate representation of the name of a legal person that corresponds to the manner the name is pronounced.

LegalPersonNameID.title: LegalPersonNameID
LegalPersonNameID.description: The name and type of name by which the legal person is known using latin characters.

legalPersonName.description: The name which the legal person is known.

LocalLegalPersonNameID.title: LocalLegalPersonNameID
LocalLegalPersonNameID.description: The name and type of name by which the legal person is known using local characters or an alternate represesentation of a name that corresponds to the manner in which the name is pronounced.

legalPersonName.description: The name which the legal person is known using local characters or a phonetic representation.

LegalPersonNameTypeCode.title: LegalPersonNameTypeCode
LegalPersonNameTypeCode.description: A single value corresponding to the nature of name being specified for the legal person. LEGL refers to the official name under which an organization is registered. SHRT specifies a short name of the organization. TRAD is a name used by a business for commercial purposes, although its registered legal name, used for contracts and other formal sitautions, may be another.

NaturalPerson.title: NaturalPerson
NaturalPerson.description: A uniquely distinguishable individual; one single person.

geographicAddress.description: The particulars of a location at which a person may be communicated with (zero or more).

customerIdentification.description: A distinct identifier that uniquely identifes the person to the institution in context; often a crypto wallet address or customer account number.

countryOfResidence.description: Country in which a person resides (the place of a person's home).

NaturalPersonName.title: NaturalPersonName
NaturalPersonName.description: The distinct words used as identification for an individual. At least one occurrence of a natural person's name ID must have the value LEGL specified as the natural person name identifier type. At least one name identifier is required, and zero or more local and phonetic name identifiers can be added for ease of identification.

nameIdentifiers.description: Full name separated into primary and secondary identifiers (at least one required and at least one must have the LEGL type).

localNameIdentifiers.description: Full name separated into primary and secondary identifiers using local characters.

phoneticNameIdentifiers.description: Alternate representation of a name that corresponds to the manner the name is pronounced.

NaturalPersonNameID.title: NaturalPersonNameID
NaturalPersonNameID.description: A full name separated into primary and secondary identifiers using latin characters transliterated using an appropriate script.

primaryIdentifier.description: This may be the family name, the maiden name or the married name, the main name, the surname, and in some cases, the entire name where the natural person's name cannot be divided into two parts, or where the sender is unable to divide the natural person's name into two parts.

secondaryIdentifier.description: These may be the forenames, familiar names, given names, initials, prefixes, suffixes, or Roman numerals (where considered to be legally part of the name) or any oither secondary names.

LocalNaturalPersonNameID.title: LocalNaturalPersonNameID
LocalNaturalPersonNameID.description: Either a full name separated into primary and secondary identifiers using local characters or an Alternate representation of a name that corresponds to the manner the name is pronounced.

primaryIdentifier.description: This may be the family name, the maiden name or the married name, the main name, the surname, and in some cases, the entire name where the natural person's name cannot be divided into two parts, or where the sender is unable to divide the natural person's name into two parts. This name should be represented in local characters or as a phonetic pronounciation.

secondaryIdentifier.description: These may be the forenames, familiar names, given names, initials, prefixes, suffixes, or Roman numerals (where considered to be legally part of the name) or any oither secondary names. This name should be represented in local characters or as a phonetic pronounciation.

NaturalPersonNameTypeCode.title: NaturalPersonNameTypeCode
NaturalPersonNameTypeCode.description: A single value corresponding to the nature of name being adopted for identification. ALIA refers to an alias name other than the legal name by which a natural person is also known. BIRT is a name aassigned a natural person at birth. MAID is the original maiden name of the natural person who has changed their name after marraige. LEGL is a legal name that identifies a natural person for legal, official, or administrative purposes.

Address.title: Address
Address.description: A valid address that identifies the natural or legal person. There must be at least one occurrence of the element addressLine or the occurrence of streetName and buildingName and/or buildingNumber.

department.description: Identification of a division of a large oraganization or building.

subDepartment.description: Indentification of a sub-division of a large organization or building.

streetName.description: Name of a street or thoroughfare.

buildingNumber.description: Number that identifies the position of a building on a street.

buildingName.description: Name of the building or house.

floor.description: Floor or storey within a building.

postBox.description: Numbered box in a post office, assigned to a person or organization, where letters are kept until called for.

postCode.description: Identifier consisting of a grup of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist in sorting of mail.

townName.description: Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries and a local government.

townLocationName.description: Specific location name within the town.

districtName.description: Identifies a subdivision within a country subdivision.

countrySubDivision.description: Identifies a subdivision of a country for example, state, region, province, départment or county.

addressLine.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text.

country.description: Country code of the country location of the address.

AddressTypeCode.title: AddressTypeCode
AddressTypeCode.description: Identifies the nature of the address. HOME implies a residential home address; BIZZ a business address; and GEOG is an unspecified physical address sutable for identification of a natural or legal person.

DateAndPlaceOfBirth.title: DateAndPlaceOfBirth
DateAndPlaceOfBirth.description: Detailed information about a natural person used to specifically distinguish that person from others with similar names. The primary constraint is that the date of birth must be in the past.

dateOfBirth.description: Date on which a person is born

placeOfBirth.description: The town and/or the city and/or the suburb and/or the country subdivision and/or the country where the person was born.

NationalIdentification.title: NationalIdentification
NationalIdentification.description: Valid national identification for the person. Natural persons must specify the national identifier, national identifier type, and country of issue. Legal persons must not have a value for country of issue and must have a value for registration authority if the type is not LEIX.

nationalIdentifier.description: An identifier issued by an appropriate issuing authority

registrationAuthority.description: A code specifying the registration authority from the GLEIF Registration Authorities List.

NationalIdentifierTypeCode.title: NationalIdentifierTypeCode
NationalIdentifierTypeCode.description: Identifies the national identification type. Natural persons can use the identifiers "ARNU" (alien registration number), "CCPT" (passport number), "DRLC" (driver's license number), "FIIN" (foreign investment identity number), "SOCS" (social security number), or "IDCD" (identity card number). Legal persons can use the identifiers "RAID" (registration authority identifier), "FIIN", "TXID" (tax identification number), or "LEIX" (legal entity identifier) where "LEIX" is preferred for legal persons.

TransactionPayload.title: TransactionPayload
TransactionPayload.description: A TRISA message that assists the compliance officer in identifying a virtual asset transaction on the chain. The goal of this payload is to provide enough information to link travel rule compliance information in the identity payload with a transaction on the blockchain or network.

txid.description: A transaction ID or hash unique to the chain/network

originator.description: the crypto wallet address of the originator

beneficiary.description: the crypto wallet address of the beneficiary

amount.description: the amount of the transaction in the smallest unit to the available network/asset type

network.description: The three character SLIP-0044 network code describing the chain the virtual asset belongs to. Coming Soon: DTI.

timestamp.description: The RFC3339 formatted timestamp of when the on-chain transaction occurred.

extra_json.description: any extra transaction related compliance data as a base64 formatted JSON object.

asset_type.description: If the blockchain network hosts multiple asset types, the identifier of the asset type being transferred.

tag.description: An optional memo or destination tag related to the beneficiary wallet for transfer purposes.

PendingPayload.title: PendingPayload
PendingPayload.description: A control flow message to support asynchronous TRISA transfers. Pending messages can be returned as an intermediate response during a compliance transfer if further processing is required before a response can be sent.

envelope_id.description: The TRISA envelope ID that refers to the compliance communication.

received_by.description: The name of the recipient compliance officer or recipient VASP.

received_at.description: The RFC3339 formatted timestamp when the request was received.

message.description: an optional message to respond with to the counterparty.
message.example: This transaction is under compliance review.

reply_not_after.description: The RFC3339 timestamp when the response will be returned by.

reply_not_before.description: The RFC3339 timestamp before which not to expect a response.

extra_json.description: Any extra data as a base64 encoded JSON object.

example.message: This transaction is under compliance review.

bearerAuth.description: Authentication with JWT bearer token obtained using an API key and the authenticate endpoint.

page_size.name: page_size
page_size.description: Specify the page size for a paginated list request, e.g. the number of records to return in a single request.

next_page_token.name: next_page_token
next_page_token.description: Used to specify the next page in a series of paginated list requests. Page tokens expire, so make sure to use them in a sequence of requests to retrieve a large list.

prev_page_token.name: prev_page_token
prev_page_token.description: Used to specify the previous page in a series of paginated list requests. Although reverse iteration is not necessarily supported, this token can allow refresh of a previous page fetched during paginated iteration.

query.name: query
query.description: The name of the vasp to search for. The best bet is to use the shortest search query possible to return the most results.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Limit the number of records to return in a single search query.

post.description: Authenticate your client with your API Key and receive a JWT claims package that can be used as a Bearer token to authenticate future requests.

requestBody.description: An API authentication JSON payload with the API key client id and secret.

errors.error: missing client_id: this field is required
missing client_secret: this field is required

post.description: The JWT `access_token` will eventually expire and can no longer be used to authenticate requests. The `refresh_token` can be used to reauthenticate your client without having to post the client ID and secret again. Note that reauthenticate will only work after the refresh token's `nbf` (not before) claim and before the tokens' `exp` (expires) claim.

requestBody.description: A JSON payload with the refresh token as the primary element.

errors.error: missing refresh_token: this field is required

get.description: Export a complete CSV file of all transaction information on the Envoy node. The download is performed in a streaming fashion so that the entire transactions dataset can be exported. API Clients are recommended to read the transaction and write to disk in chunks for memory safety.

schema.description: A comma delimited columns and newline delimited rows CSV file with double quote escaping.
schema.example: ID,Status,Counterparty,Originator,Originator Address,Beneficiary,Beneficiary Address,Virtual Asset,Amount,Last Update,Created,Number of Envelopes,HMAC Signature

post.description: This endpoint allows you to use a simplified data entry form that only requires transfer, originator and beneficiary details along with the travel address of the beneficiary in order to construct a complete IVMS101 Identity and Transaction payload. The IVMS101 payload is far more complex than the simple form, so it's often a first place to start when creating a transaction. This endpoint also populates the payload with the originator and beneficiary VASP legal person details using the counterparty information on the node.

localNameIdentifiers.legalPersonName: 日本仮想通貨取引所株式会社

example.error: could not parse prepare transaction data

errors.error: missing travel_address: this field is required
missing originator.crypto_address: this field is required

post.description: This endpoint allows you to easily create a transaction and send the travel rule transfer/inquiry to the counterparty using one of the available travel rule protocols in a single step. If the transaction doesn't exist, it is automatically created by the server; if it does exist, it is updated and the payload is sent to the counterparty for compliance processing. This method is generally the best way to create transactions as it simplifies the initialize transaction workflow. When used in conjunction with the Prepare endpoint, this endpoint can reduce the amount of work your API client has to perform.

requestBody.description: Prepared Payload as Returned from Prepare Endpoint

localNameIdentifiers.legalPersonName: 日本仮想通貨取引所株式会社

200.description: Succesfully Sent IVMS101 Payload for Existing Transaction

201.description: Succesfully Created Transaction and Sent IVMS101 Payload

example.error: could not parse prepared transaction data

errors.error: missing travel_address: this field is required
missing originator.crypto_address: this field is required

post.description: When an incoming travel rule transfer/inquiry is received, if a webhook is configured on the Envoy node, the node will make a POST request with the incoming information and expects a reply that can be sent to the initiating counterparty.

requestBody.description: Callback request contains decrypted secure envelope data and other metadata related to the transfer.

transaction_id.description: The related transaction ID, also the TRISA envelope ID

properties.description: Must return the same transaction ID to the server.
